page.title: 12THE DONKEY SANCTUARY.
page.content: The Donkey Sanctuary at Slade Farm is owned by Mrs Svendson. Over two thousand donkeys have been in its care but most move on to one of the other farms owned by Mrs Svendson. At the moment there are 176 donkeys at Slade Farm. Over 70 people are employed over all the farms. There is a hospital for the donkeys and a resident vetinary surgeon. Many of the donkeys are in a poor state of health when they arrive. Some donkeys are used in The Slade Centre to give rides to handicapped children, who are brought to the Centre by a special ambulance coach, owned by the Centre. The children ride in carts or on the donkeys and enjoy stroking the donkeys. There are other activities for them to do and they have lunch at the Centre. The Centre has specially trained staff for the children.
